general-settings.title: Cinnamon desktop components where effects will be applied

appswitcher-warning.description: Note: The Alt-Tab effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

desklets-warning.description: Note: The Desklet effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

desktop-warning.description: Note: The Desktop effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

expo-warning.description: Note: The Expo effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

popup-warning.description: Note: The Menu effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

notification-warning.description: Note: The Notification effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

overview-warning.description: Note: The Overview effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

panel-warning.description: Note: The Panel effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

tooltips-warning.description: Note: The Tooltip effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

windows-warning.description: Note: The Window effects are currently disabled under the "General setup" tab.

desklets-label.description: Note: You must configure your Desklets to be transparent! (see tooltip)
desklets-label.tooltip: In order for Blur Cinnamon Desklet effects to be visible, a Desklets background must be transparent. This allows the blur effect to be visible below the Desklet. Most Desklets can be configured to have transparent backgrounds. On the Desktop, right-click on a Desklet, select the "Configure..." menu item to open a Desklet's configuration window.

windows-label.description: Note: Read tooltip for information about the "Default window settings"
windows-label.tooltip: If the special "Default window settings" table entry is enabled then all windows will have effects applied. If it is disabled then only the applications defined in the table will have effects applied. If the "Enabled" option is unchecked for a particular application then effects will be disabled even if the "Default window settings" row is enabled.

about-text.description: Brining your style into focus Version: ext-version Developed by: Kevin Langman Github / Report an issue / Website The rounded corners and Gaussian effects are based on code by aunetx (Blur-my-shell) Github / Ko-fi The Overview effect is partially based on the BlurOverview extension by nailfarmer

enable-overview-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the Overview (default: Ctrl+Alt+Down / 'Show all windows` hot corner)

enable-expo-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the Expo (default: Ctrl+Alt+Up / 'Show all workspaces` hot corner)

enable-panels-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the Panels. This option should work well with most dark desktop themes but light themes could also be made to work with some creative use of the dimming color settings and an appropriate background image. It overrides some themes settings to achieve a (semi-)transparent panel so that the blurred background is visible.

enable-popup-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to panel popup menus. This option is intended for the Cinnamon (6.4) and Mint-Y dark desktop themes but might work well with other themes. Light themes are unlikely to give good results but might be made to work with some creative use of the dimming color settings and an appropriate background image. It overrides some theme settings to achieve a (semi-)transparent menu so that the blurred background is visible.

enable-desktop-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to desktop background image. Desktop effects can be applies always or just when a window has the focus.

enable-notification-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the notification popups. This option has been tested with the Cinnamon (6.4) and Mint-Y dark desktop themes but might work will with other themes. It overrides some theme settings to achieve a (semi-)transparent Notification popup window so that the blurred background is visible.

enable-appswitcher-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the Alt-Tab application switcher background when setup to use the Coverflow or Timeline styles

enable-tooltips-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to the panel tooltip backgrounds. It overrides some theme settings to achieve a (semi-)transparent tooltip so that the blurred background is visible.

enable-window-effects.tooltip: Allow application window background effects by adding an effect actor below all existing graphical elements of affected windows. This means the effects will NOT be visible unless the application is setup to be transparent or the "Opacity" setting for the window is less than 100%. The table under the "Windows" component settings is used to determine which applications (if any) will have effects applied to its windows, enabling this option alone will not add effects to any windows.

enable-desklet-effects.tooltip: Apply effects to Desklet backgrounds. Desklets must be setup to be transparent in order for the Blur Cinnamon effects to be visible.

focused-window-backlight.tooltip: Apply a background image based backlight effect to the currently focused window. The effect spills over the focused windows borders making the window appear to glow around the edges. If the focused window is transparent, this effect will also show a blurred background image behind the window.

allow-transparent-color-panels.description: Override some of the panels theme settings (recommended)
allow-transparent-color-panels.tooltip: Allow this extension to modify the panels transparency and background color settings. If this is disabled the extension will only apply a blur background under the panels. This setting should only be disabled when the theme already uses transparent panels and you want the themes setting to apply.

allow-transparent-color-popup.description: Override some of the popup menu theme settings (recommended)
allow-transparent-color-popup.tooltip: Allow this extension to modify the popup Menu transparency and background color settings. If this is disabled the extension will only apply a blur background under the popup menus. This setting should only be disabled when the theme already uses transparent popup menus and you want the themes setting to apply.

enable-overview-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the Overview

enable-expo-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the Expo

enable-panels-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the Panels

enable-popup-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the popup menus

enable-desktop-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the desktop background

enable-notification-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the notification popups

enable-appswitcher-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the Alt-Tab app switcher

enable-tooltips-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the panel tooltips

enable-desklets-override.description: Use unique effect settings for the Desklets

enable-desklets-unique-settings.description: Enable advanced options to apply unique settings for each Desklet
enable-desklets-unique-settings.tooltip: With this option enabled each Desklet can use different settings or you can disable effects completely for some Desklets.

enable-panel-unique-settings.description: Enable advanced options to apply unique settings for each panel
enable-panel-unique-settings.tooltip: With this option enabled each panel can use different settings or you can disable effects completely for some panels.

panel-unique-settings.tooltip: Defines the effects applied to different panels. If a panel does not meet the criteria of any enabled entry in this list, it will have no effects applied. The settings of the first entry in this list that can apply to a given panel will take effect. The "Custom" check box determines if the generic effect settings are uses or this tables custom settings. The color field is in the rgb(#,#,#) syntax and black will be used when a color is not provided or is in an incorrect syntax

no-panel-effects-maximized.description: Restore theme settings when a window is maximized
no-panel-effects-maximized.tooltip: Restore the themes panel settings when any window is maximized on the same monitor as the panel. For most themes this will restore a solid panel background when a window is maximized. Note: This does not remove the blurring, so if your theme uses a transparent panel then this setting may have no effect.

blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

overview-blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

overview-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

overview-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

expo-blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

expo-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

expo-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

panels-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

panels-blurType.tooltip: What type of background effect should be applied

panels-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

panels-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

popup-applet-menu-effects.description: Apply effects to applet popup menus

popup-panel-menu-effects.description: Apply effects to panel context menus

popup-title-menu-effects.description: Apply effects to window title bar context menus

popup-accent-opacity.description: Additional popup menu accent elements dimming (%)
popup-accent-opacity.tooltip: Defines the additional dimming applied to the popup menu accent elements (i.e. the main menu favorites box and entry boxes) which allow these elements to stand out from the other popup menu areas

popup-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

popup-blurType.tooltip: What type of background effect should be applied

popup-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

popup-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

desktop-without-focus.description: Only apply effect settings if the desktop is not in focus
desktop-without-focus.tooltip: When enabled, the desktop background image effects will only apply when the desktop is not in focus

desktop-with-focus.description: Apply the generic effect settings when the desktop is in focus
desktop-with-focus.tooltip: When enabled, the generic effect settings (on the "Generic effect settings" tab) will apply to the desktop background image when the desktop is in focus

desktop-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

desktop-blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

desktop-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

desktop-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

notification-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

notification-blurType.tooltip: What type of background effect should be applied

notification-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

notification-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

notification-test-button.tooltip: This button will cause a notification message to appear so you can see how your notification setting behave.

appswitcher-info.description: Note: Alt-Tab effects only apply to the Coverflow and Timeline 3D Alt-Tab configurations

appswitcher-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

appswitcher-blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

appswitcher-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

appswitcher-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

tooltips-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

tooltips-blurType.tooltip: What type of background effect should be applied

tooltips-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

tooltips-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

desklets-blendColor.tooltip: Defines the color that is blended into the background based on the dimming control above. Use black for a normal dimming effect or some other color for a color blend effect

desklets-blurType.tooltip: What type of blur algorithm should be used to blur the background

desklets-radius.tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the blur effect by changing the radius use by the effect.

desklets-saturation.tooltip: Adjusts the color saturation of the background image from gray-scale to full color.

windows-inclusion-list.tooltip: This table controls which application windows will have effects applied and the effect settings. When "Custom" is enabled the setting defined by this table will apply, otherwise the "Generic effect settings" will apply. The "Application" field can be a WM_CLASS or a desktop file name.

windows-add-button.description: Add entry for the application of the most recently focused window
windows-add-button.tooltip: Focus a window you want to enable window effects on then return here and press this button.

windows-compiz-mitigation.description: Disable "Compiz" effects for windows with Blur Cinnamon effects
windows-compiz-mitigation.tooltip: When enabled, the window moving effect created by the "Compiz windows effect" extension will be disabled for windows with Blur Cinnamon effects applied. This option will have no effect unless the "Compiz window effect" extension is installed and active.

desklets-auto.description: Automatically enable effects for newly added Desklets
desklets-auto.tooltip: When enabled, new Desklets added to the desktop will automatically have Blur Cinnamon effects applied. When disabled, Desklets will only have effects applied when manually enabled in the table below. By default the settings applied to new Desklets will be the generic effect settings.

desklets-list.tooltip: The "Enabled" check box controls which Desklets will have effects applied. The "Custom" check box controls if a Desklet will use the generic effect settings or the custom settings defined in this table. The custom settings can be modified by double clicking on a table row.
